Message: Well Costello, I'm going to New York with you. You know, Bucky Harris, the Yank's manager gave me a job as coach for as long as you're on the team.
Look Abbott, if you're the coach, you must know all the players.
Well, I never met the guys, so you'll have to tell me their names, and then I'll know who's playing on the team.
Oh, I'll tell you their names, but you know strange as it may seem, they give these ball players now a days, very peculiar names.
Strange names, pet names. Like, Dizzy Dean, and'
Goofe' Dean, oh I see! Well let's see, we have on the bags, we have Who's on first, What's on second, and I Don't Know is on third.
That's what I want to find out.
I say, Who's on first, What's on second, and I Don't Know's on third.
You going to be the coach too?
And you don't  know the fellow's names?
Well then who is on first?
I'm asking you who's on first!
Well go ahead and tell me.
Look, you got a first baseman?
When you pay off the first baseman every month, who gets the money?
All I'm trying to find out is the fellow's name on first base.
The guy that gets the money.
Who gets the money on first base?
He does, every dollar! Sometimes his wife comes down and collects it.
Look, all I want to know is when you sign up the first baseman, how does he sign his name to the contract?
All I'm trying to find out is what's the guy's name on first base.
I'm not asking who's on second.
Well don't change the players around!
All I'm asking you, who's the guy on first base?!
What's the guy's name on first base?!
I'm not asking you who's on second!
Oh, he's on third. We're not talking about him. Now let's get back to first.
Now how did I get on third base?
If I mentioned the third baseman's name, who did I say's playing third?
There I go, back on third again! Will you stay on third base and don't go off it?
Alright, what do you want to know?
Why do you insist on putting Who on third base?
What am I putting on third?!
You don't want who on second?!
I just thought I'd ask you.
Well I just thought I'd tell you.
Then tell me who is playing left field.
I'm not'Stay out of the infield! I want to know, what's the guy's name in left field?
I'm not asking who's on second.
Look, look, look, you got a pitcher?
You don't want to tell me today?
At what time tomorrow are you going to tell me who's pitching?
Now listen, Who is not pitching. Who is on'
I'll break your arm you say who's on first! I want to know, what's the pitcher's name?
All we got is a couple of days on the team. You know, I'm a catcher too.
I get behind the plate, do some fancy catching. Tomorrow's pitching on my team and a heavy hitter gets up.
Now, the heavy hitter bunts the ball. When he bunts the ball, me being a good catcher, I want to throw the guy out at first base. So I pick up the ball, and throw it to who?
Now that's the first thing that you've said right.
I don't even know what I'm talking about!
Well that's all you have to do!
Is throw the ball to first base?
Look, if I throw the ball to first base, somebody's got to get it. Now who has it?
So I pick up the ball and throw it to Naturally?
No you don't! You throw the ball to Who!
I throw the ball to Naturally?
I throw the ball to who?
You throw the ball to Who?

Same as you! I throw the ball to who. Whoever it is drops the ball, the guy runs to second, who picks up the ball, throw's it to what, what throw's it to I don't know, I don't know throw's it back to tomorrow, triple play!
Another guy gets up, and it's a long fly ball to because. Why? I don't know, he's on third, and I don't give a darn!
I said, I don't give a darn!
